traits.name: Fear of Fire
entries: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
entries: Melee atk +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7 damage) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6 damage) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
entries: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 (6d6 damage) cold damage and then be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

actions.name: Cold Breath {@recharge}
entries: The yeti exhales a 30-foot cone of frigid air. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8 damage) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
